issue.title: (inactive) backdrop blocks parts of my app
issue.body:
Hi,

Whenever the loader is not showing (`[show]="false"`), the backdrop still blocks everything because of its high z-index. I can't manage to override the z-index, and can only omit this issue by putting an *ngIf on the component which checks for the same value as the `[show]` does.

My component is as simple as this.
`<ngx-loading [show]="displayLoader" [config]="config"></ngx-loading>`

Preferrably, we'd have an option to disable the backdrop altogether. In my case this is unwanted anyway, and I made it transparent.

comment.body: Hi, please can you show how this issue can be reproduced? The backdrop should not be present if show is not set to true.

repo.name: ngx-loading
repo.description: A loading spinner for Angular applications.

repo.name: ngx-loading
repo.description: A loading spinner for Angular applications.

issue.title: Full screen backdrop isn't working in Edge
issue.body:
Hey! I've found a little bug with **fullScreenBackdrop** option in Edge explorer, what happens is that backdrop appears but it doesn't fit to the screen like in Google Chrome.

Here is mi code:
```html
<ngx-loading [show]="true"
             [config]="{ backdropBorderRadius: '3px', fullScreenBackdrop: true}"
></ngx-loading>
```
**ngx-loading version:** ^3.0.1
**Angular version:** ~8.1.2
**Edge version:** 44

comment.body: Just tested this in later (supported) versions of the library and Edge and was not able to reproduce. Please re-open if this is still an issue
